This removes the clear button at the top of the list, and adds
an "X" to the active item in the "filter by collection" list. The hit target
will remain the same (you'll be able to click anywhere on the collection), it's

We may reuse this style for other lists in the sidebar in the future. We won't
use it for sorting though, since you have to sort by something, amirite?

cards.desc:
```
ian/rpc-errors
```

Live updates should work slightly better when polling now. This also makes minor changes to socket-based live updates.

You should normally be getting live updates over sockets. You can force polling by opening the console and running `window.pitStop()`, then restore sockets with `window.dropTheHammer()`.

This branch contains changes necessary to eventually fix https://trello.com/c/9IYqC9Rm/2250-removing-user-from-board-does-not-hide-the-board-from-them-if-they-have-it-open, but it doesn't do that yet.

cards.desc:
# Plan

- migrate all existing `EditableView` code to use `EditableFieldView`
- clean up all the now-unnecessary code that we can eliminate with `EditableView` out of our lives
- get `EditableFieldView` up to feature parity with `EditableView`
- test, test, test
- ship a version of the app that uses `EditableFieldView` for current fields, but no new ones, to ensure everything is stable
- extend `EditableFieldView` with new features to support non-field-backed-inputs
- convert comment editing, comment authoring, and checkitem authoring to use `EditableFieldView`
- test, test, test
- ship

# Phase 1 (done)

- card name (done)
- card description (done)
- checklist name (done)
- checkitem name (done)
- board description (done)
- list name (done)

# Phase 2

- `Layout.isEditing`
- `Layout.cancelEdits`
- `js-no-higher-edits`
- `keepEdits`

# Phase 3

- special handling for fields that shouldn't be empty
- special handling for "single-line" fields
    - some which *can't* contain newlines at all (checkitem), others require shift-enter
- "text is too long" error message
- click-away behavior and X button behavior are currently different
- only one field should be editable at a time
- `CardDetailView::editTitle`
- `AutoInsertionView` and `CompleterUtil`
- escape behavior (done)

# Bugs

- all the CSS is wrong
- list title selection is being broken by something dumb higher in the propagation

# Intentional changes

- you can no longer edit the board name from the board description dialog
- the board description view has the same format helper as the card description, instead of a link to Gruber's markdown page
- editing the card name no longer triggers the editing typing indicator
